episodeTitle: The Straw Hats Stunned! The New Fleet Admiral of the Navy!
description: A celebration is held at Ryugu Palace following the defeat of Hody Jones. Jinbe reveals shocking news about the New World, including Akainu's victory over Aokiji and Blackbeard's rise as a Yonko. Meanwhile, Neptune discusses the Ancient Weapons with Robin, unaware that Caribou is eavesdropping.

events.title: Jinbe Reveals Akainu vs Aokiji Battle Outcome
events.description: Jinbe informs the Straw Hats about the epic ten-day battle between Admirals Akainu and Aokiji on Punk Hazard for the position of Fleet Admiral. Akainu emerged victorious, and Aokiji left the Marines rather than serve under him.
events.significance: Establishes major power shift in the Marines and introduces the devastation of Punk Hazard, which becomes crucial for future arcs. This reveals the ideological conflict within the Marine leadership.

quotes.text: Akainu fought against Aokiji for the title of Fleet Admiral on a certain island. Akainu won the title and Aokiji left since he did not want to work under Akainu.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Explaining the major changes in the Marine hierarchy during the two-year timeskip

events.title: Punk Hazard's Environmental Transformation Revealed
events.description: Jinbe explains that the ten-day battle between Akainu and Aokiji permanently altered Punk Hazard's climate. One half of the island is now perpetually frozen while the other burns eternally, demonstrating the catastrophic power of Admiral-level Devil Fruit awakening.
events.significance: Foreshadows the Punk Hazard arc and demonstrates the devastating environmental impact of high-level Devil Fruit battles. This is crucial evidence of Devil Fruit awakening's environmental effects.

events.title: Blackbeard Confirmed as Fourth Yonko
events.description: Jinbe reveals that Marshall D. Teach has conquered Whitebeard's former territories and claimed his position as one of the Four Emperors, joining Shanks, Charlotte Linlin (Big Mom), and Kaidou as the rulers of the New World.
events.significance: Establishes the new power balance in the New World and confirms Blackbeard's rise to ultimate pirate power. This sets up future confrontations and demonstrates the success of Blackbeard's plan from Marineford.

quotes.text: Marshall D. Teach took all of Whitebeard's territories and claimed the title of Emperor alongside Shanks, Charlotte Linlin, and Kaidou.
quotes.speaker: Jinbe
quotes.context: Explaining the new Yonko lineup to the Straw Hats

events.title: Shirahoshi Revealed as Poseidon to Robin
events.description: King Neptune confides in Nico Robin that Princess Shirahoshi is the Ancient Weapon Poseidon, possessing the power to command the Sea Kings. He reveals that this power is inherited by mermaid princesses every few centuries and warns Robin not to tell anyone.
events.significance: One of the biggest reveals in the series, connecting Shirahoshi to the Ancient Weapons and the Void Century. This information makes Shirahoshi one of the most important characters for the endgame and explains the true nature of Poseidon.

quotes.text: There are three ancient weapons: Pluton, Uranus, and Poseidon. And Shirahoshi is Poseidon.
quotes.speaker: King Neptune
quotes.context: Revealing to Robin the truth about the Ancient Weapons and his daughter's identity

events.title: The Three Ancient Weapons Named
events.description: Neptune and Robin discuss the three Ancient Weapons from the Void Century: Pluton, Poseidon, and Uranus. Neptune explains that these weapons have the power to destroy the world, and warns about the danger if the World Government discovers Shirahoshi's identity.
events.significance: Provides crucial information about the Ancient Weapons that drive much of the series' overarching plot. This connects multiple story arcs including Alabasta, Skypiea, and Fish-Man Island.

events.title: Caribou Overhears Shirahoshi's Secret
events.description: Caribou eavesdrops on Neptune and Robin's conversation about Shirahoshi being Poseidon. He realizes he can sell this information to the highest bidder or use the mermaid princess for his own gain, setting up future threats.
events.significance: Creates a serious threat to Shirahoshi's safety and demonstrates how dangerous this information is. This sets up Caribou as a recurring character who knows one of the series' biggest secrets.

events.title: Caribou Attempts to Kidnap Shirahoshi
events.description: Caribou sneaks into Shirahoshi's room and attempts to capture her, planning to sell her or use her powers for his own purposes. However, his plan is interrupted when Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji discover him.
events.significance: Demonstrates the immediate danger of the secret being exposed and shows Caribou's villainous nature. This is the first direct threat to Shirahoshi after the truth about Poseidon is revealed.

events.title: Luffy Kicks Caribou Out of the Palace
events.description: Upon discovering Caribou's kidnapping attempt, Luffy kicks him with tremendous force, sending him flying from the palace tower and crashing down to Fish-Man Island. This prevents the kidnapping but allows Caribou to escape with knowledge of Shirahoshi's identity.
events.significance: Protects Shirahoshi in the immediate term but creates a long-term threat as Caribou escapes with dangerous knowledge. Shows Luffy's protective nature toward his friends.

events.title: Neptune Offers Stolen Treasure as Reward
events.description: After learning that Caribou stole the royal treasure, King Neptune tells Nami that he will give it to the Straw Hats as a reward for saving Fish-Man Island if they can retrieve it. Nami immediately orders Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji to chase after Caribou.
events.significance: Shows Neptune's gratitude toward the Straw Hats and Nami's love for treasure. This creates motivation for the crew to pursue Caribou.

events.title: Hody Jones and Crew Suffer Energy Steroid Side Effects
events.description: In their prison cells, Hody Jones and his officers are shown dramatically aged and weakened as the side effects of the Energy Steroids take hold. Despite being only 30 years old, Hody appears as a frail elderly man with white hair, wrinkled skin, and hunched posture.
events.significance: Demonstrates the severe consequences of the Energy Steroids and serves as a cautionary tale about shortcuts to power. This permanently removes Hody as a threat and shows the price of his hatred-fueled ambitions.

events.title: Pekoms and Tamago Shadowed Appearance
events.description: Two members of the Big Mom Pirates, Pekoms and Tamago, arrive at Fish-Man Island in shadowed silhouettes. They have come to collect the monthly candy tribute that Fish-Man Island owes to Big Mom in exchange for her protection.
events.significance: First introduction of Big Mom's crew members and sets up the conflict over the candy tribute. This begins the chain of events that leads to Luffy's confrontation with Big Mom.

events.title: Big Mom's Candy Tribute Demand
events.description: Pekoms and Tamago announce they have come to collect Fish-Man Island's monthly payment of candy to Big Mom. However, the candy factory was destroyed during Hody's rebellion, creating an impossible situation for the island.
events.significance: Sets up the immediate conflict that leads to Luffy declaring war on Big Mom. This incident becomes the catalyst for the Whole Cake Island arc and establishes Big Mom's business-like approach to protection.

themes.description: The episode explores how the pursuit and abuse of power leads to devastating consequences, shown through Hody's premature aging from Energy Steroids and the environmental destruction of Punk Hazard from the Admiral battle.
themes.symbolism: Hody's aged appearance symbolizes how hatred and shortcuts corrupt and destroy, while Punk Hazard represents how power struggles between titans leave lasting scars.

themes.description: Neptune's revelation about Shirahoshi being Poseidon demonstrates the burden of dangerous knowledge and the responsibility of protecting world-changing secrets.
themes.symbolism: The Ancient Weapons represent forbidden knowledge from the Void Century that could reshape the world's power balance.

themes.description: The episode focuses on how the world has transformed during the two-year timeskip, with new leadership in the Marines and a new Yonko taking Whitebeard's place.
themes.symbolism: The shift from Sengoku/Whitebeard era to Akainu/Blackbeard era represents the end of one age and the beginning of a harsher, more brutal era.

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe serves as the bridge between the Straw Hats and the wider world, updating them on critical changes during their absence and demonstrating his knowledge of New World politics.
keyActions: Reveals Akainu vs Aokiji battle outcome
Informs crew about Blackbeard becoming a Yonko
Discusses the new power structure of the New World
quotes: Marshall D. Teach took all of Whitebeard's territories and claimed the title of Emperor.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's knowledge of the Ancient Weapons and Poneglyphs makes her the perfect confidant for Neptune's revelation. Her archaeological expertise connects the past to the present.
keyActions: Discusses the three Ancient Weapons with Neptune
Understands the connection to the Void Century

characterSpotlights.development: Caribou transforms from a defeated enemy to a dangerous wild card who possesses knowledge of one of the world's most dangerous secrets.

Gets kicked out of the palace by Luffy

characterSpotlights.development: Shirahoshi's true nature as Poseidon is revealed, elevating her importance in the overall story from damsel in distress to one of the most powerful beings in the world.
keyActions: Identity as Poseidon revealed to Robin
Becomes target of Caribou's kidnapping attempt
Protected by Luffy and the Straw Hats

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended Caribou's reaction when discovering he's been found and added more visual detail to Hody's aged appearance.
Nami's presence during the prison visit to see Hody's aged crew was added in the anime and wasn't in the manga.

trivia.fact: Episode 570 covers only pages 2-17 of Chapter 650, making it one of the slower-paced adaptations with significant padding to extend the runtime.
This episode achieved a 9.5% viewer rating, ranking 6th among One Piece episodes, demonstrating high audience interest in the post-Marineford revelations.

The battle between Akainu and Aokiji mentioned in this episode lasted 10 days and permanently changed Punk Hazard's climate, one of the first confirmed instances of environment-altering Devil Fruit awakening.
Pekoms and Tamago make their debut in shadowed silhouettes only, with their full designs revealed in the following episode.
